metadata.synopsis: Following the death of her beloved minister father (J. Wharton James), Ozark girl Pollyanna (Mary Pickford) travels to the faraway town of Beldingsville to be raised by Polly (Katherine Griffith), her cantankerous spinster aunt. Teaching everyone in town the "Glad Game," Pollyanna improves the mood of the locals and even finds a home for her orphan friend, Jimmy (Howard Ralston). But when a serious injury dampens her cheer, Pollyanna needs the love of her distant aunt in order to recover.

reviews: Even our beloved and serious- minded Mary Pickfcrd errs in this, her latest production, in trying to jam an emotion, or rather an effect, down our throats.
